H0.text: Chemical state of the solute is the factor upon which the majority of solution properties depend.

H1.text: Similar state of solute is what the majority of solution properties depend upon.

H2.text: The gas state of solute is what the majority of solution properties depend upon.

H3.text: Acid state of solute is what the majority of solution properties depend upon.

A4.text: colligative properties are independent of the nature of the solute

A5.text: additive properties such as mass depend on the composition (or molecular formula) of the solute

A6.text: constitutional properties depend further on the molecular structure of the given solute

A7.text: The solution has the same physical state as the solvent.

A8.text: Polar solutes dissolve in polar solvents, forming polar bonds or hydrogen bonds.
